definition: meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]

sentences.english: Alex's spending on food this month went over budget.
sentences.chinese: 艾力克斯這個月的伙食費超出了預算。

sentences.english: The salesman padded the bill for his travelling expenses by exaggerating his food expenses.
sentences.chinese: 推銷員誇大伙食費的開支來虛報出差費。

sentences.english: The salesman padded the bill for his traveling expenses by exaggerating his food expenses.
sentences.chinese: 那位推銷員誇大伙食費用以此浮報差旅費。

sentences.english: Every person spent about 300 yuan a month on food.
sentences.chinese: 每個人每天大約花費300元伙食費。

sentences.english: At university we need at least 300 yuan to cover the board expenses.
sentences.chinese: 在大學我們至少需要300元來支付伙食費。

sentences.english: You can enjoy decent meals with 300 RMB per month.
sentences.chinese: 每生月伙食費300元，可達中等稍上的水平。

sentences.english: During the time of detention the detainee's food costs shall be paid by himself.
sentences.chinese: 在拘留期間，被拘留人的伙食費由自己負擔。

sentences.english: The meal plan be20 dollars each for five breakfast and four supper.
sentences.chinese: 伙食費方式是每人20美元，喫五頓早餐和四頓晚餐。

sentences.english: After affair take place, he still compensated 300 dollars to do boarding fee for all of the cow mountains.
sentences.chinese: 事情發生後，他還賠償了300元給牛山全做伙食費。

sentences.english: The man agreed, giving her 3, 000 dong every day to feed the girl.
sentences.chinese: 這男人統一了，給她3000盾一天作爲伙食費。

sentences.english: The balance of my board expenses was all spent on new books for English learning.
sentences.chinese: 我將伙食費的節餘部分全用來購買英語學習的新書了。

definition: to pay sb else's expense with the expectation of being reimbursed by that person later
